isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, AND 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - HOOD

step1.para: Release hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then detach the tilt assist spring assemblies as follows.
Refer to Figure 4 for all Items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Remove cotter pin (Item 3) (and washers, if so equipped) at tilt assist spring bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1), driver side shown.
Pull out the retaining pin (Item 4) that secures the tilt assist spring assembly clevis (Item 6) to the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1), driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove the passenger side tilt assist spring assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 4. 9200 Hood Stop Cables and Tilt Assist Springs

step1.para: Disconnect the front end wire harness connectors and ground connection located near the radiator on both sides, if so equipped, or disconnect the front end wire harness connector and ground connections on the engine side of the dash panel next to the air cleaner. Remove wire harness from the frame rail loop clamps, as necessary. (The harness stays with the hood.)
To remove the hood, remove 1 of the cap nuts (Item 2, Figure 5) from each of the hood hinge pins (Item 4, Figure 5), then remove the other cap nut with hinge pin from each hinge.
With an assistant, remove the hood assembly. Place the hood on an appropriate padded surface to protect painted surfaces.

figure.caption: Figure 5. 9200 Hinge Bracket and Crossmember Assembly

svcsubproc.title: 9200 (Before July 1996) - Install
svcsubproc.para: If required, assemble tilt assist springs, stop cables, splash panels, hinge bushings and the lower hinge yoke to the hood before mounting it.
Refer to Figure 5 for all Items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Place a padded work stand in front of the vehicle. With an assistant, rest the hood assembly on the work stand. Position the hood assembly in place and install the hinge pins with cap nuts (Item 4 and 2) into each hinge.
Install the other cap nut (Item 2) on each of the hinge pins (Item 4).

Connect the front end wire harness connectors and ground connection located near the radiator on both sides, if so equipped, or connect the front end wire harness connector and ground connections to the appropriate engine side dash panel connectors. Secure the wire harness at the frame rail with the loop clamps provided, as necessary.

Carefully tilt the hood to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then attach the tilt assist spring assemblies to the mounting brackets on top of the radiator as follows.
Refer to Figure 4 for all Items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Position the tilt assist spring assembly clevis (Item 6) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1), driver side shown.
Install the retaining pin (Item 4) (and washers, if so equipped).
Install cotter pin (Item 3) in retaining pin (Item 4) securing the tilt assist spring assembly to the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1), driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to install the passenger side tilt assist spring assembly.

step1.para: Close the hood and latch the hood on both sides.

Release hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then detach the tilt assist spring assemblies as follows:
Refer to Figure 6 for all Items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Remove the cotter pin (Item 4) (and washer, if so equipped) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 6) on top of the radiator (Item 7), driver side shown.
Pull out the retaining pin (Item 5) that secures the tilt assist spring assembly (Item 3) to the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 6) on top of the radiator (Item 7), driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove the passenger side tilt assist spring assembly.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 7for all Items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

Remove the hex bolt and hex lock nut (Item 2) and remove the shock absorber (Item 1) from the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 4) on the driver side. Then remove the hex bolt and hex lock nut (Item 5) and remove the shock absorber from the radiator shock absorber bracket (Item 3) on the driver side of the radiator assembly.

Disconnect the front end wire harness connectors and ground connection located near the radiator on driver side, if so equipped, or disconnect the front end wire harness connector and ground connections on the engine side of the dash panel next to the air cleaner. Remove wire harness from the frame rail loop clamps, as necessary. (The harness stays with the hood.)
To remove the hood, remove 1 of the cap nuts (Item 2, Figure 8) from each of the hood hinge pins, then remove the other cap nut with hinge pin (Item 7, Figure 8) from each hinge.
With an assistant, remove the hood assembly. Place the hood on an appropriate padded surface to protect painted surfaces.

svcsubproc.title: 9300 SBA and SFA - Install
svcsubproc.para: If required, assemble tilt assist springs, stop cables, splash panels, insulator panels, hinge bushings, and the lower hinge yoke to the hood before mounting it.

step1.para: Position the shock absorber (Item 1, Figure 7) at the radiator shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 7) on the driver side of the radiator assembly, then install the hex bolt and hex lock nut (Item 5, Figure 7) before mounting the hood to the chassis.

Place a padded work stand in front of the vehicle. With an assistant, rest the hood assembly on the work stand. Position the hood assembly in place and install the hinge pins with cap nuts (Item 7, Figure 8) into each hinge.
Install the other cap nut (Item 2, Figure 8) on each of the hinge pins with cap nuts (Item 7, Figure 8).

Connect the front end wire harness connectors and ground connection located near the radiator on driver side, if so equipped, or connect the front end wire harness connector and ground connections to the appropriate engine side dash panel connectors. Secure the wire harness at the frame rail with the loop clamps provided, as necessary.

Carefully tilt the hood to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then attach the tilt assist spring assemblies to the mounting brackets on top of the radiator as follows.
Refer to Figure 6for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Position the tilt assist spring assembly (Item 3) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 6) on top of the radiator (Item 7), driver side shown.
Install the retaining pin (Item 5) (and washer, if so equipped).
Install cotter pin (Item 4) in retaining pin (Item 5) securing the tilt assist spring assembly to the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 6) on top of the radiator (Item 7), driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to install the passenger side tilt assist spring assembly.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 7for all items in parentheses.
Position the shock absorber (Item 1) at the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 4) on the driver side of the hood assembly, then install the hex bolt and hex lock nut (Item 2).
Close the hood and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: 9400 (Before July 1996) - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 9 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Release hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then detach the tilt assist spring assemblies as follows.

step2.para: Remove the cotter pin (Item 4) (and washer, if so equipped) at both tilt assist spring brackets (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 8), driver side shown.
Pull out the retaining pin (Item 3) that secures the tilt assist spring assemblies (Item 1) to both tilt assist spring brackets (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 8), driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove the passenger side tilt assist spring assemblies.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 7 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

Remove the hex bolt and hex lock nut (Item 2) and remove the shock absorber (Item 1) from the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 4) on the driver side. Then remove the hex bolt and hex lock nut (Item 5) and remove the shock absorber from the radiator shock absorber bracket (Item 3) on the driver side of the radiator assembly.

Disconnect the front end wire harness connectors and ground connection located near the radiator on both sides, if so equipped, or disconnect the front end wire harness connector and ground connections on the engine side of the dash panel next to the air cleaner. Remove wire harness from the frame rail loop clamps, as necessary. (The harness stays with the hood.)
To remove the hood, remove the cotter pins and flat washers (Items 2 and 1, Figure 10), then remove the hood hinge pins (Item 3, Figure 10) from each hinge.
With an assistant, remove the hood assembly. Place the hood on an appropriate padded surface to protect painted surfaces.

svcsubproc.title: 9400 (Before July 1996) - Install
svcsubproc.para: If required, assemble tilt assist springs, stop cables, splash panels, hinge bushings and the lower hinge yoke to the hood before mounting it.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 7for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

Position the shock absorber (Item 1) at the radiator shock absorber bracket (Item 3) on the driver side of the radiator assembly, then install the hex bolt and hex lock nut (Item 5) before mounting the hood to the chassis.

Place a padded work stand in front of the vehicle. With an assistant, rest the hood assembly on the work stand. Position the hood assembly in place and install the hinge pins (Item 3) into each hinge.
Refer to Figure 10for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.
Install the flat washers and cotter pins (Items 1 and 2) into each of the hood hinge pins (Item 3).

Connect the front end wire harness connectors and ground connection located near the radiator on both sides, if so equipped, or connect the front end wire harness connector and ground connections to the appropriate engine side dash panel connectors. Secure the wire harness at the frame rail with the loop clamps provided, as necessary.

Carefully tilt the hood to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then attach the tilt assist spring assemblies to the mounting brackets on top of the radiator as follows.

step2.para: Refer to Figure 9 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.
Position the tilt assist spring assemblies (Item 1) at the tilt assist spring brackets (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 8), driver side shown.
Install the retaining pin (Item 3) (and washers, if so equipped).

Install the cotter pin (Item 4) in the retaining pin (Item 3) securing the tilt assist spring assemblies (Item 1) to the tilt assist spring brackets (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 8), driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to install the passenger side tilt assist spring assemblies.

step1.para: Position the shock absorber (Item 1, Figure 7) at the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 4, Figure 7) on the driver side of the hood assembly, then install the hex bolt and hex lock nut (Item 2, Figure 7).
Close the hood and latch the hood on both sides.
Remove 4 mounting nuts (Item 1, Figure 11), 2 each side, and remove the grille (Item 2, Figure 11) before removing the hood. This will allow access to the hex bolts and hex lock nuts at each hinge.

Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then detach the tilt assist spring assemblies as follows.
Refer to Figure 12 for all items in parentheses unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Remove the cotter pin and flat washer (Item 1) from the retaining pin (Item 2) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 4) on top of the radiator, passenger side shown.
Pull out the retaining pin (Item 2) that secures the tilt assist spring assembly (Item 3) to the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 4) on top of the radiator, passenger side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove the driver side tilt assist spring assembly.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 13 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

Remove the cotter pin and retaining pin (Item 1) and remove the shock absorber (Item 2) from the radiator shock absorber bracket (Item 3). Then remove the cotter pin and retaining pin (Item 4) and remove shock absorber from the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 5).

Disconnect the front end wire harness connectors and ground connection located near the radiator, driver side. Remove wire harness from the loop clamp, if so equipped. (The harness stays with the hood.)

To remove the hood, remove the hex lock nuts and washers (Items 1 and 2, Figure 14) from each of the hex bolt hinge pins (Item 3, Figure 14), then remove the hex bolt hinge pin and washer (Items 3 and 2, Figure 14) from each hinge.
With an assistant, remove the hood assembly. Place the hood on an appropriate padded surface to protect painted surfaces.

svcsubproc.title: 9200 AND 9400 (After July 1996) and 9100 (After March 1997) - Install
svcsubproc.para: If required, assemble tilt assist springs, stop cables, splash panels, hinge bushings and the lower hinge yoke to the hood before mounting it.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 14 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.
Place a padded work stand in front of the vehicle. With an assistant, rest the hood assembly in place and install the hex bolt hinge pins and washers (Item 3 and 2) into each hinge from the outside.
Install the washer and hex lock nut (Items 1 and 2) on each of the hex bolt hinge pins (Item 3). Tighten to 50 to 55 ft-lbs. (68 to 75 Nm).
Connect the front end wire harness connectors and ground connection located near the radiator, driver side. Secure the wire harness with the loop clamp, if so equipped.

Carefully tilt the hood to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then attach the tilt assist spring assemblies to the mounting brackets on top of the radiator as follows.
Refer to Figure 12 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Position the tilt assist spring assembly (Item 3) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 4) on the top of the radiator, passenger side down.
Install the retaining pin (Item 2) through the tilt assist spring assembly clevis and tilt assist spring bracket (Items 3 and 4).

Install the cotter pin and flat washer (Item 1) that secure the retaining pin (Item 2) that holds the tilt assist spring assembly (Item 3) to the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 4) on top of the radiator, passenger side shown.
Repeat procedure to install the driver side tilt assist spring assembly.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 13 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

Position the shock absorber (Item 2) at the radiator shock absorber bracket (Item 3) then install the bolt and nut (Item 1). Then install shock absorber at the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 5) and install the bolt and nut (Item 4).
Position the grille (Item 2, Figure 11) in place over the 4 studs, 2 each side, and install the 4 mounting nuts (Item 1, Figure 11).
Close the hood and latch the hood on both sides.

Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then detach the tilt assist spring assemblies as follows.
Refer to Figure 15 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Remove the cotter pin (Item 7, View Circle C) [and washer (Item 8, View Circle C), if so equipped] at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 9) on top of the radiator (Item 6), on both sides.

Pull out the retaining pin (Item 1, View Circle C) that secures the tilt assist spring assemblies (Item 4, View Circle), 2 each side, to the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 9) on top of the radiator (Item 6), on both sides.

step1.para: Disconnect the front end wire harness connector and ground connections on the engine side of the dash panel next to the air cleaner.
Remove the wire harness from the frame rail loop clamps. (The harness stays with the hood.)
To remove the hood, remove the cotter pin, slotted hex nut and flat washer (Items 2, 1, and 3, Figure 16) from each side at the hood mounting bracket (Item 10, Figure 16).
With an assistant, remove the hood assembly. Place the hood on an appropriate padded surface to protect painted surfaces.

figure.caption: Figure 15. 5000 SFA Tilt Assist Spring Assembly

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SFA - Install
svcsubproc.para: If required, assemble tilt assist springs, stop cables, splash panels, hinge bushings and the hinge mounting bracket to the hood before mounting it.
Refer to Figure 16 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Place a padded work stand in front of the vehicle. with an assistant, rest the hood assembly on the work stand. Position the hood mounting bracket (Item 10) in place on the pivot mounting rod (Item 9) on both sides.

If required, install the hood bracket bushings and springs (Items 5 and 4) over the pivot mounting rod (Item 9) and into the hood mounting bracket (Item 10), then install the flat washers, slotted hex nuts and cotter pins (Items 3, 1, and 2) onto the threaded end of the pivot mounting rod, both sides.
Connect the front end wire harness connector and ground connections to the appropriate engine side dash panel connectors. Secure the harness at the frame rail on the loop clamps provided.

Carefully tilt the hood to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then attach the tilt assist spring assemblies to the mounting brackets on top of the radiator as follows.
Refer to Figure 15for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Position tilt assist spring assemblies (Item 4, View Circle C) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 9) on top of the radiator (Item 6), on both sides.
Install the retaining pin (Item 1, View Circle C) [and washer (Item 8, view Circle C), if so equipped].

Install cotter pin (Item 7, View Circle C) in the retaining pin (Item 1, View Circle C) securing the tilt assist spring assemblies (Item 4, View Circle C) to tilt assist spring bracket (Item 9) on top of radiator (Item 6), on both sides.

step1.para: Close the hood and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA (After August 1994) Fiberglass Tilt Hood - Remove

step1.para: Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then detach the tilt assist spring assemblies as follows.
Refer to Figure 17for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Remove the cotter pin (Item 3) (and washer, if so equipped) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1), driver side shown.
Pull out the retaining pin (Item 4) that secures the tilt assist spring assembly clevis (Item 5) to the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1), driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove the passenger side tilt assist spring assembly.

step1.para: Disconnect the front end wire harness connector and ground connections on the engine side of the dash panel next to the air cleaner.
Remove the wire harness from the frame rail loop clamps. (The harness stays with the hood.)

To remove the hood, remove 1 of the cap nuts (Item 2, Figure 18) from each of the hood hinge pins (Item 4, Figure 18), then remove the other cap nut with hinge pin (Items 2 and 4, Figure 18) from each hinge.
With an assistant, remove the hood assembly. Place the hood on an appropriate padded surface to protect painted surfaces.

figure.caption: Figure 17. 5000 SBA Tilt Assist Spring Assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: 9. COTTER PIN, WASHERS AND CLEVIS RETAINING PIN

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA (After August 1994) Fiberglass Tilt Hood - Install
svcsubproc.para: If required, assemble tilt assist springs, stop cables, splash panels, hinge bushings and the lower hinge yoke to the hood before mounting it.

step1.para: Place a padded work stand in front of the vehicle. With an assistant, rest the hood assembly on the work stand. Position the hood assembly in place and install the hinge pins with cap nuts (Items 4 and 2, Figure 18) into each hinge.
Install the other cap nut (Item 2, Figure 18) on each of the hinge pins (Item 4, Figure 18).
Connect the front end wire harness connector and ground connections to the appropriate engine side dash panel connectors. Secure the harness at the frame rail on the loop clamps provided.

Carefully tilt the hood to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies, then attach the tilt assist spring assemblies to the mounting brackets on top of the radiator as follows.
Refer to Figure 17for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step2.para: Position the tilt assist spring assembly clevis (Item 5) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1) driver side shown.
Install the retaining pin (Item 4) (and washer, if so equipped).

Install the cotter pin (Item 3) in the retaining pin (Item 4) securing the tilt assist spring assembly clevis (Item 5) to the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 2) on top of the radiator (Item 1), driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to install the passenger side tilt assist spring assembly.

step1.para: Close hood and latch on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA (After August 1994) Optional Butterfly Hood - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 19 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Release both hood latches (Item 19) on both sides of the hood assembly. Raise each side of the hood, as required, to remove mounting hardware to remove the hood as follows.

Remove 2 flat head screws and lock nuts (Items 7 and 18, View G-G) that secure the front hinge retainer (Item 13, View G-G and View Circle A) to the radiator shell flange (Item 15, View G-G and View Circle A) and the stay rod bracket assembly (Item 14, View G-G),
Remove shoulder bolt and spring washer (Item 2, View Arrow C) from each side that attach butterfly hood to hood support assembly (Item 1, View Arrow C).
Pull the center hinge pin (Item 16, View Circle B) out of the rear hinge retainer (Item 8, View Circle D).
With an assistant, lift off the butterfly hood assembly.

note.para: If necessary, separate the hood assembly into four pieces - left and right upper hood panels (Items 10 and 3), and left and right side hood panels (Items 11 and 6) - by removing the side hinge pin (Item 12, View E-E) from each side and center hinge pin (Item 16, View Circle B).

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA (After August 1994) Optional Butterfly Hood - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 19 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: If disassembled, assemble the upper right hood panel and right side hood panel (Items 3 and 6) by installing the side hinge pin (Item 12, View E-E), then assemble the upper left hood panel and left side hood panel (Items 10 and 11) by installing the side hinge pin (Item 12, View E-E).
Assemble the right and left hood assemblies by installing the center hinge pin (Item 16, View Circle B).
With an assistant, position the butterfly hood assembly between the cowl flange (Item 9, View Circle D) and the radiator shell flange (Item 15, View Circle A).
Attach the butterfly hood to the hood support assembly (Item 1, View Arrow C) and secure it by installing the shoulder bolt and spring washer (Item 2, View Arrow C) on each side.

Position the center hinge pin (Item 16, View Circle B) into the rear hinge retainer (Item 8, View Circle D), then position the center hinge pin in the front hinge pin retainer (Item 13, View G-G and View Circle A) and secure it to the radiator shell flange (Item 15, View Circle A) and stay rod bracket assembly (Item 14, View G-G) with 2 flat head screws and lock nuts (Items 7 and 18, View G-G).
Close the hood, and fasten the hood latches on both sides.
